article:
I grew up in three cultures: I was born in Pairs, my parents were from China, and I was  brought up  mostly in America. When I was young, this was very   _  : Everyone said that their   _  was the best, but I knew they couldn't all be right. I felt that there was an   _  that I would choose to be Chinese or French or American. For many years I was stuck among the three, trying on each but never being   _  comfortable. I hoped I wouldn't have to  _  , but I didn't know what that meant and how exactly to "not choose".
However, the   _  of trying on each culture taught me something. As I struggled to   _  . I came to understand what made each one unique. At that point, I   _  that I didn't need to choose one culture to get rid of  50 another , but instead I could choose from all three. The values I selected would become part of   _  I was, but no one culture needed to  _  . I could honor the cultural depth and longevity of my   _  heritage, while feeling just as passionate about the deep artistie traditions of the French and the American commitment to  _  and the future.
So,  rather than  settling on any one of the cultures in which I grew up, I now choose to explore many more cultures and  56 _ elements to love in each. Every day I make a(an)  _  to go toward what I don't understand. This wandering leads to the accidental learning that continually   _  my life.
As I work in music today, I try to carry out this  _  ---that the music I play, like me, doesn't belong to only one culture, where I have found new 60 _ in my own music making.
